str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To surpass, excel, exceed, transcend. From huper and ballo; to throw beyod the usual mark, i.e. to surpass.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From pleroo; repletion or completion, i.e. what fills, or what is filled.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
